texts.text: I take off the keyring that was hooked around my finger and put it on the table.
It makes a tinny clinking noise.
I sit down in a chair and sigh.
There's a bottle of water laid out for me.
Very considerate of them.
There's a knock on the door, and it opens before I can answer.
I know the person who's just come in.
Why do you even bother knocking?
Hahah, sorry 'bout that. It's just been so long! I came running all the way here!
Sumomo smiles merrily.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: How long has it been?
I forgot, and I'd rather not try to remember. Makes me feel damn old.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hahah, good point.
Sumomo laughs as she puts down her bag.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: All right. Let's get this show on the road.
She moves around behind me and starts playing with my hair.
She feels it out first with her hands, and then a comb.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: The first time you had me cut it was in that garage, remember?
Right. Never thought we'd make it here back then.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I don't think anyone did, to be fair.
I nod in response.
I close my eyes, and let the comfortable sensation of her hands take over. I think back on that dusty garage.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Now that was a fun summer, huh?
I know the person who's just come in.
Why do you even bother knocking?
Hahah, sorry 'bout that. It's just been so long! I came running all the way here!
Sumomo smiles merrily.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: How long has it been?
I forgot, and I'd rather not try to remember. Makes me feel damn old.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hahah, good point.
Sumomo laughs as she puts down her bag.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: All right. Let's get this show on the road.
She moves around behind me and starts playing with my hair.
She feels it out first with her hands, and then a comb.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: The first time you had me cut it was in that garage, remember?
Right. Never thought we'd make it here back then.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I don't think anyone did, to be fair.
I nod in response.
I close my eyes, and let the comfortable sensation of her hands take over. I think back on that dusty garage.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Now that was a fun summer, huh?
That's right. I forgot it was summer...
The blinding sunlight, the sweltering heat.
The garage with that faded old four-by-four.
The cries of the cicadas so loud they almost hurt your ears.
The comet sweeping through the night sky.
I find my mind traveling back to those days...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: There we go...
This place used to be an international airport.
Countless pigeons make their nests in the abandoned jumbo jets.
It was only last month when I realized there was such a treasure trove of photography subjects right by my house.
This is how I spend my weekday afternoons.
All my classmates are at the academy taking their lessons.
At first I felt a little guilty about not attending, but I don't anymore.
I hear the wind blow by, the gravel crunch beneath my feet...
And the faint cooing of the pigeons.
Time passes peacefully.
In the distance I see a passenger plane, its paint chipping away.
A behemoth of a vehicle that made its last flight long ago.
I like its melancholy air.
Peering through the lens of my camera, I feel around for a good composition.
When I tilt my camera up slightly, the viewfinder captures the comet with its long tail above.
I lower the camera.
Not yet.
This is neither the time nor the place to capture it.
I look at my wristwatch.
I should be getting back.
My break is over.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: This one, maybe?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Or... maybe this one...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Looks nothing like the manual... What's this? Can I take it off?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Ugh, I don't know!
I kick the ground, and the wheels below me slide me out from under the car.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Haah...
I sit up and look through the car's maintenance manual.
The manual is tattered from use, but I still don't understand a lick of it.
The car is a four-by-four left to me by my mom. Its name is Hachimaru.
It's slick like a samurai, and cute to boot.
My mom always called it Hachimaru, and the name stuck with me.
Hachimaru's been silent for a long time now, but I can tell its spirit is alive.
It's July already.
This is the month.
I don't have any time left.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Maybe one of the wires is frayed?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Better take another look.
I lie back down on the creeper I rigged up with a board and some caster wheels.
My sweaty shirt sticks to my back.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's so hot in here...
I found out “creeper” is the name for those wheeled boards that mechanics use to slide under cars.
It's one of the few things I managed to glean from that worn-out old manual.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Dammit. I'm not getting anywhere.
I'm getting impatient. I've really not got time for this.
The sun is setting.
I've gotta take a shower before dad gets home.
If he finds me covered in oil, he'll figure out I was tinkering with the car instead of going to class.
I really don't know the first thing about cars.
But I have until the 28th of this month to somehow get this thing running.
If possible, with my own two hands.
I insert the key into the ignition.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Figures.
I get out of the car, wipe my face with a towel, and head to the sink in the corner of the garage.
Another day with no luck.
I see myself in the mirror, covered in oil.
I wipe at the grease with a damp towel.
It's really hard to get it off.
My eyes stray to the cork board next to the mirror.
It's covered with pictures taken by my mom.
These photos always give me heart.
One is of a comet streaking across the starry sky.
Contemplating the vastness of the universe makes me feel so small... yet at the same time, like maybe my problems aren't so insurmountable after all.
The photo must have inspired those same contradictory feelings in many. It's probably why her work was so popular.
She went wherever she felt like in her car, and took pictures of whatever she wanted.
People called her a "survivalist photographer."
Then, last year, Mom went off on one such trip. Hachimaru came back... but Mom didn’t.
I look at the wall clock through the mirror.
It's already 5 PM.
I prepare to leave the garage with my bag and the clothes I changed out of.
Looking up at the scarlet sky, I see the comet and its long tail drawing a majestic arc through the firmament.
That's Halley's Comet.
It approaches Earth every 76 years.
Excitement has been simmering throughout the world for the last three years, and this year it finally reached boiling point.
The sales of binoculars, telescopes, books, and cameras skyrocketed.
The stores are filled with comet-related merchandise, and impromptu astronomy clubs began to pop up as winter shifted toward spring.
But even before the public at large started gearing up for it, my mom was always thinking of the comet.
Getting to witness an event that takes place only once every 76 years is a miraculous thing for a photographer.
She was always looking for the perfect place to shoot it from. She didn't want to waste the opportunity.
But Mom never lived to see the year 2061.
July 28th...
That's the day when the comet will be closest to the Earth. When its luminosity will reach its peak.
Mom wanted a picture of that beautiful comet.
I'm going to take one for her.
Today's July 8th.
I have twenty days.
Before I go into the house, I check the mailbox.
It contains the evening paper and some leaflets from the neighborhood association.
There's also a letter from the academy.
It's common for them to send one when you're absent without notice for a long time.
I crumple it up and stuff it into my pocket.
I'm about to shove the other letters back into the mailbox when one leaflet in particular catches my eye.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Repairs on the go? Marvellous mechanic Azuki?
Former hit MeTuber Azuki will come to your house and repair any vehicle...
What's a MeTuber?
Never mind that.
Diagnosis is free. Offer applies to old-style and gasoline cars as well.
I stare at the simple handwritten leaflet for a while.
No...
I shake my head.
Mom always kept Hachimaru running herself.
The best people take care of their own tools.
I can't give up yet.
I turn back and gaze once more at the comet hanging in that crimson sky.
Just in case, I fold up the sketchy leaflet and stow it in my pocket.
I take a shower and change.
Dad's always home by at least 8 PM.
If only he got home later, I could focus more on repairing the car. Then once it was fixed, I could spend that time on my photography instead.
Dad doesn't know I'm trying to fix the car or that I'm really into photography.
I try very hard to make sure he doesn't notice.
I need things to work things out before I tell him.
Photography is a pretty unrealistic profession, so I need proof that I have what it takes.
Real, tangible proof.
Once I have that, I'll tell him.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Hello there.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hey. How was work?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Still no haircut? It's way too long.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Summer break's next week. I'll get it done then.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: It's too hot for long hair. Get it trimmed.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, yeah.
It's just the two of us sitting at the table.
We're having curry. Again.
We only eat things we can make in advance over the weekend.
We take turns prepping meals on Sundays, then we store the batch in the fridge for the week.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: You decided on a faculty yet?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...I still have time.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: You gotta submit your choice during the summer of your second year, right? You still haven't decided?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's fine. It's not like I'm going to a new school.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: The science and humanities faculties charge different fees. You better decide soon.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Leaving it to the last minute makes it harder on me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...I know.
This is all we ever talk about at dinner.
It wasn't like this when Mom was around.
It was all about the problems that came up during her shoots. About stars, mountains, or car stuff...
Mom was great at telling stories.
I would actively laugh along, while Dad just ate and nodded placidly.
That was our standard family dinner.
But it's different now.
Dad and I just don't seem to know how to hold a conversation.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Don't get complacent because there's no entry exam. You gotta choose what to do with your life before you get left behind.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I know. I'll decide first thing next week.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Good.
What my dad wants from me is to get through school, get a job, climb the ladder, marry...
He just wants a safe and stable life for me.
If I told him I wanted to be a photographer like mom, he'd probably do a spit-take, like in a cartoon.
If I want to convince him...
I need objective proof, like a license or an award, that I can really make a living at this.
The fact that my mom did it isn't enough.
Even I know that much.
There'll be tons more photo contests than usual this summer.
This summer is the battlefield on which I'll make my future.
I wake up and grab the clothes I usually wear to the academy.
I just put them on for show and take them off again after eating breakfast and seeing Dad off to work.
I wear different clothes to when I'm working, since I tend to get them dirty pretty fast.
It would be easier if we had a uniform at the academy, but we have no such thing.
I get dressed between drowsy yawns.
Still half asleep, I pull on my pants and button my shirt.
Then I pick up my bag and leave the room.
When I stop by the kitchen on my way out, my dad's just taking a slice of toast out of the toaster.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Where are you going?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: The academy.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: It's Saturday.
That's when I realize I've messed up.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh, right.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: This isn't the first time you've make this kind of mistake. Get your head out of the clouds.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Besides, it's past 10 AM already. You wouldn't even make it in time.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Hahah...
Faking a laugh, I drop my bag, go to the fridge, and take out a milk carton to pour myself a glass.
I spread peanut butter on a slice of toast and take a bite.
Dad continues sipping his coffee, his attention focused on his newspaper.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're gonna stay home all day?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm heading out for a bit.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Hm, who could that be?
Dad gets up and goes to the door.
Guess I can't go to the garage for the next two days.
I'll just have to go out and take pictures somewhere.
Where should I go this weekend?
I ponder my options while chewing on my toast.
I work through the slice bite by bite between sips of milk.
Dad's not back yet.
Who was at the door?
I pop the last bit of toast into my mouth and reach out for the glass of milk when...

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Kanna.
Turning around, I see my dad walking into the living room with a young woman in tow.
She has black hair in a shoulder-length bob. She's wearing black-rimmed glasses and a plain suit.
Her eyes are a striking rose color that are at odds with the rest of her presentation.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Who's this?
Dad heaves a huge sigh.
The woman has a troubled smile on her face.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: How long have you been skipping classes?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: This lady here says she's a student teacher at the academy.
Confused, I look up at my dad.
Then I slowly shift my gaze to the woman next to him.
My name is Momonouchi Sumomo. It's really nice to meet you.
Her bright tone sounds really out of place for the situation.
She has an unusual name too. Lots of "momo"s in there. Incidentally, "momo" means "peach" in Japanese.
A long, drawn out silence falls over us.
My dad clears his throat every few seconds.
Each time, the woman looks at my dad, then turns to me and smiles awkwardly.
When she moves, a soft scent quite unlike anything my house usually smells of tickles my nose.
Is it shampoo? Or her detergent?
Get a grip, man. This is no time for getting distracted by smells.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Um...
With his eyes still closed, Dad says nothing.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yes?
Instead, the woman responds.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Amei... Ah, can I call you Kanna?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I mean, your dad's name is Amei too. You can call me Momonouchi, though.
What's with this lady? Shouldn't she address him with a "Mr"?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So, Kanna, let's see...
She pulls out a piece of paper, and my attention is drawn to it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So... this has been going on since the latter half of May. You attended three times during June, and none so far in July, right?
My dad sighs again. It sounds like a dragon growling.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Did something happen? Are you having problems at the academy?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No, nothing like that.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I just don't have time.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: You're a student. How can you have no time?!
When my dad rebukes me loudly, the woman almost jumps in surprise.
I heave a sigh of resignation.
The cat's out of the bag now.
I hoped it wouldn't come to this.
I take a deep breath.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I've been in the garage.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: The garage? You mean your mom's?
I nod.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: And what have you been doing in there?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...I can't tell you.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Do you understand the situation you're in? Your teacher came all the way here.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, don't worry about me. I picked the gig myself, so it's not like I'm mad about being made to work or something.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Why haven't you been going to your classes? I'm waiting to hear a good reason.
Guess I really have no choice.
I take another deep breath.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...I wanna be a photographer.
Eyes on the ground, I mutter the truth.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Photographer?
The woman repeats my last word, as though sounding it out.
She seems a little slow for a teacher.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm practicing with Mom's camera.
Dad's sigh sounds exasperated now.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: You can do what while attending your classes. That's no excuse.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mom went pro when she was my age. That's excuse enough for me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm want to dedicate all my time to it.
He shakes his head.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Stop being such a kid. Being a photographer just seems more glamorous to you than attending classes, isn't that right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's not like that.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: You underestimate the career. You can't just ride on your mom's coat tail and suddenly make it work.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I know that!
That's not what I'm trying to do.
I've always wanted to be a photographer.
It's always been in my mind.
I just got this far without telling anyone.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I knew Anna better than anyone else ever could. Not a moment went by when she wasn't thinking about photography.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I know that as well as you...
I hear my voice getting smaller.
This is why I didn't want this.
I always shrink down before him whenever we talk.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Then how about you? I've never even seen you with a camera in your hands.
I take pictures all the time.
I just don't tell anyone. But I still do it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Um...
The woman timidly interjects.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Who's Anna?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: My wife. She passed away last year.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh... My condolences.
My dad gives her a courteous nod and turns back to me.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I understand you want to become a photographer, but you can't abandon your studies. What if it doesn't work out?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: You won't have any qualifications.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But the later I start, the harder it'll be.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: When Mom died last year, I realized we never know when our time will be cut short.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I understand your impatience, but it won't be too late after you finish college.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Life is longer than you think.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We don't know what. What about Mom?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Kanna, I...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But I'm sure Mom didn't regret anything.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And that's how I wanna live.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Do it after graduating college. After that, I won't say a word.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I'm the one paying for it. At least meet me halfway here.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...I never asked you to pay for me.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't wanna go to university.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Knock it off with this nonsense!
The woman beside my dad shrinks back a little after that outburst.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Mom would understand.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: What was that?
Silence falls.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I... I don't want to be like you.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna, that's a bit...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I want to live like Mom did.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If I have to be like you to live a long life, I'd rather die young like Mom.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I wanna do what I wanna do.
Then, I close my eyes and brace myself.
I expect to get yelled at.
He might even hit me.
I'm sure of it.
But what I hear after the silence is not a slap. It's the sound of his chair dragging across the floor.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mister...

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: ...I thought you were more grown up than this.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I'm disappointed.
And with that, he leaves the room.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Uh, s-sorry?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You didn't do anything wrong.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But I kinda wanna scram, you know?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uh, what do you mean?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Like, me? From here? I kinda wanna do like a tree and leave.
She brings the mug of coffee my dad had offered her to her lips.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: ...Too honest?
I decide to ignore her.
She's getting kinda overly familiar now that my dad's gone.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Anyway, it's not like you hate the academy, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Not really.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Then why not come? I mean, summer vacation's in five days anyway. Think of it as, like, a change of pace.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't know anyone there. What's the point?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Duly noted, pal.
What's with this woman?
Is she really a teacher?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You heard what I said. I'm not going. I have stuff to do.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But that's a big ol' problem for me, you see.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: All I gotta do is make you go to the academy, you feel me?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't care...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hear me out, would you? I was told that I wouldn't be recognized as a teacher if I couldn't get you to show up.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And after I finally found an academy willing to do more than just kick my sorry butt out the front door and all. I can't be letting them down now!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But why?! It's not even my problem.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I sent a ton of letters and got nowhere. But you wouldn't happen to know anything about that, would you? Bet they never reached your dad, did they?
She's right.
I always throw away the letters from the academy before Dad goes to pick up the newspaper.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Sides, don't you kinda need a change of scenery after that spat with your daddy?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I mean, I bet you two'd get along just fine if you came to class for the rest of the semester!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It looked to me like your daddy worries about you a whole lot.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Just one week. Five days, even! And then you'd have a leg to stand on in front of him! Now that's what I call cost effective!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's only five days out of your whole entire life! Come on!
For a flickering moment, I see her point.
But then I think it over.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't wanna half-ass anything. I decided to focus on photography this summer.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: The whole summer?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Can you leave already, lady?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hmm, maybe after I have another little talk with your daddy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Whatever.
I get up.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Catch you later. I'll drop by again tomorrow.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You can bet your ass I'll come here everyday until you give in. I want that sweet teaching license.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're so annoying.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: If I'm that annoying, just come to class and get me off your back! It's just five days!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You do know your dad's being a pain in the butt just because he cares, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Stay out of my business.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And... there he goes.
I'm freaking exhausted.
That was super awkward.
Did I really have to see any of that?
They've left me here alone, and it's honestly a relief.
I wonder when any of them will be back.
Sighing to myself, I lean back.
How did things end up like this?
Besides, why is it even my job to bring back a dropout? Isn't that a bit much?
I'm only a student teacher, for God's sake.
Why are the professors always punching down? Damn...
But Kanna and his dad did call me a teacher.
I must look like one from the outside.
That's fine.. right?
I mean, for now.
That's what I decided, after all.
Even though this ain't the real me.
Man, it's so stuffy.
Wearing a suit in summer is murder.
I'm not even used to wearing this damn thing.
And the wig doesn't make it any better.
I'm not like I'm going to the academy today, so I probably didn't even need to bother.
The mask slipped a little bit with Kanna just now, though.
His dad is staring at the closed door.
Ain't it a bit much to storm off into the back of the house over this?
He said that he lost his wife, right?
He's a man, so he probably feels a bit awkward about the whole thing.
I'll give him some time.
Man, I can't believe I'm wasting my weekend on this.
It's not like I've had much R\&R time since my damn teacher training started.
They have me writing stupid reports all day.
And then they complain about my handwriting and force me to stay after hours.
Painting my nails is a no go, as is my brightly-colored hair.
But it's my natural hair, you bunch of mouth breathers!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Maybe it's pointless...
Probably is.
It's not like I believe he'd be better off coming to class anyway.
I shake my head to dispel the doubts from my heart.
Mom's crying face flashes through my mind.
I'm sick of making mommy cry because of me.
I don't care for the guy she's with, but she chose him, so whatever.
I look around the living room.
It's pretty clean considering there's only men living here.
Kanna and his daddy seem like good, honest folks.
He's probably never skipped classes like this before.
My eyes swim vaguely across the room until a photo on the sideboard catches my eye.
I get up and walk over to it.
It's Kanna's daddy and a blonde-haired woman.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ooh...
She has short hair trimmed above her shoulders.
She looks really happy.
Maybe this is Anna.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Looks kinda cool.
She has a flashy hair color, and her clothes are pretty unique.
Now that's the kind of woman I like to see.
I reach out for the photo, but then I see my reflection in the glass.
So tacky. I look like a trainwreck.
Makes me feel like shit.
It's not like I want people to see me like this.
My hand stops in mid-air, and I leave the picture be.
Then, I hear a door open behind me.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Uh, hey, Mister.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Oh, you're still here. I'm sorry for that outburst earlier.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, no! I'm sorry for all this. It's kinda my fault for coming here. I...
I can't find the words.
I'm bad at this whole talking with adults thing.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm really sorry.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Don't apologize, please. I'll make you some tea.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, thank you.
I hurry back to the table and sit in front of Kanna's daddy.
His eyes look a little red.
Maybe he was crying.
Raising a kid sure seems tough.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I'm sorry you had to come here on your day off.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, don't... Yeah, don't worry. It's no big deal.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I really don't know what goes through his head these days.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yes... I think he's the talkative type though. Yeah.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: ...You do?
I give a weak nod.
Maybe I'm running my mouth again.
I glance at his face.
He seems really deep in thought.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Well, um... When I was Kanna's age, I didn't really talk with my parents much.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Compared to me, you two at least talk to each other.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I see. How about now?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Now I talk with my mommy. Ah, my mother, I mean.
When I rephrase it, he smiles a little.
He's not as scary as I thought at first.
Thank goodness.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: You don't talk with your father?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Well, uh, I kind of have two of them.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's just that my mother remarried. Nothing complicated.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Oh, I see.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I don't really talk with my new father more than I need to. He honestly just feels like my mom's partner rather than family.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I've only seen my real daddy once since the two of them divorced.
Am I maybe getting too personal?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Well, not that my life has much to do with anything.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's why think it's kind of remarkable of him to be able to say what he wants with such determination.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Being so certain of what you want at that age is kind of incredible.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So maybe you don't need to worry so much...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I mean, being close enough to fight means you two care about each other! I think that's what family's about.
Wait, didn't I tell Kanna the same thing just now?
Way to go, me. Talk about a lack of ideas.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: So he doesn't need to go to the academy?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: N-No, that's not what I said.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I know what you're trying to say. I'm grateful for your words.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: But I'm sure you'll understand when you have kids of your own. If there's a danger in his future he can't see, I want to do what I can to help him to avoid it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Of course.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: You're a college student doing your teacher training, right?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: You're doing well. I'm sure it must be because of your parents' upbringing.
I'm doing well?
Me?
Is he saying that because of the glasses, the black hair, and the suit?
I mean, I haven't been myself since I stepped foot in here.
My parents' upbringing?
What a load of bull.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I want my son to attend college too.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But why is that?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Because it'll give him more options.
I tilt my head to the side in confusion.
That's weird. Kanna said he wants to be a photographer.
Does he need other options?
Isn't it a little pointless?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: I'm sorry. This whole thing just has me a little on edge.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, no. I'm sorry for overstepping.
Still dissatisfied with his explanation, I apologize.
I have to keep my head down and just go along with it.
This isn't worth a headache.
At least I can be polite and drop the subject.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: He can be a bit of a handful, but I truly thank you for doing what you can to help him.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: O-Of course.
He bows to me.
He's literally almost hitting the table with his forehead.
And he's not coming back up at all.
Doing what I can to help him? What am I supposed to do with that?
Uh-oh. I don't think this is gonna end until I say something.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Uh, sooo... Would you mind if I spoke with him one-on-one next time?
Finally, he raises his head.

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Please do.
I heave a barely noticeable sigh.
This teaching thing sure is rough.
I can still hear him inside my head.
If I close my eyes, I can still see his shoulders slump as he leaves the room.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What the hell?
I would've preferred it way more if he hit me.
At a loss, I sump down onto the sofa.
I hate this.
Now I can work on the weekends as well.
I no longer have to pretend to go to class every day.
I don't have to sneak around.
I can be in the garage all day.
Isn't that good? Isn't that what I wanted?
I try to convince myself.
But I still feel like a sack of potatoes.
While I stare at the ceiling and stew in my thoughts, I hear a knock on the door.
The garage door slowly opens, and from it appears... the lady from before.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Um, I was just about to head home.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Then leave. You don't need permission.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoa, this is pretty cool! It's like a secret base.
It's like she's not even listening to me.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: This place looks cozy, that's for sure.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Can I come in?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I told your dad I'd try talking to you.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't care.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: He looked really sad, you know?
Suddenly, I feel a knot form in my throat.
I knew that, but I still didn't want to hear it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Can I come in?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Do whatever.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Then don't mind if I do!
She slowly walks into the garage.
Her scent hits my nose again.
A soft peachy scent.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Now this place just screams 'man cave.'
She stops to look at the pictures pinned to the corkboard.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Your mom took these?
Wordlessly, I nod.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Wow, that's awesome. I saw her picture in the living room just now. She was such a pretty woman. Like, I'm jealous.
Did she talk about my mom with Dad, too?
What did he tell her about me?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's a huge car! It's so cute! Does it run?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Not right now, but I'll get it working within the month.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah? Nice. Looks perfect for camping.
With that, she walks up to me.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mind if I sit?
Again, I simply nod.
Holding down the hem of her skirt, she perches next to me.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You mentioned it before, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mentioned what?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That you wanted to focus this summer. On your photography, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And you're fixing the car this summer, right? Something going on this summer?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Not really.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Geez, throw me a bone here, would you?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We just met today. Why would I tell you anything about myself? That'd be weird.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Duly noted, again.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But I'm kind of your teacher, you know? Even if I'm just on probation and stuff.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's not like we're COMPLETE strangers.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You gonna come next week?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No. There's no reason for me to go.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Why not?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I already made it clear I'm becoming a photographer.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: To your dad?
I nod.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hmm, I see. Well, if you wanna be a photographer, I guess you don't see much point in going to college.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But other people do?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Your dad might be blaming himself. Asking himself if he raised you badly and stuff.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...How do you know that?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Because my parents were like that.
I look up at her.
My gaze meets hers.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I didn't really go to class much either.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Haah...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I just really hated going, though.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...Why?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Do you need to ask? Who wants to go to class? It's such a damn drag.
I just keep looking up at her without giving a response.
Is that what a teacher is supposed to say?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Uh, forget I said that. I forgot I'm the teacher here for a second.
This woman's wrong in the head.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Anyway! I think it'd be better if you looked for a way to convince your dad.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: From what I heard, it doesn't sound like he's really against you being a photographer.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...I know.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Really?!
She gets so loud of nowhere that it takes me by surprise.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So you're gonna come to class?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't know about that.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But I'll talk with him again. It may take some time, though.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Thank goodness! I'd feel bad for weeks if I, like, ruined this family or something.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I mean, you guys got into this fight because I showed up.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...It's not your fault.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But I was still, like, the trigger.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okay then! I'll see you at school on Monday!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right?!
Saying nothing, I turn my eyes straight ahead.
She stares at me from the side for a while, sighs, then gets up.
And then she leaves, as fast as she came.
She's totally different to what you'd expect from looking at her.
But I see where she's coming from.
Even if I wanna be stubborn, time's still ticking by.
I get up from the sofa and grab a sketch from the corkboard.
It's a sketch my mom left behind.
It shows Halley's Comet surrounded by a conifer forest.
It looks like one of those photos taken from the inside of a cave with a hole in the ceiling.
The paper is yellowing.
She might have drawn it before I was even born.
I'm sure my mom envisioned taking her picture of the comet from this place.
And it now falls to me.
Turning around, I stare at Hachimaru.
The leaflet from yesterday comes to mind.
I'm running out of time.
If I want to get the car up and running in time for summer, I'll need more hands on deck.
I wanted to fix it myself, but I can't be picky now.
Taking the dubious mechanic's flyer out of my pocket, I take a closer look at the request form at the bottom.
I fill in the necessary info and mark the “Come to my garage” box, adding brief directions on how to get here.
If Dad finds this, he'll be all up in my ass again.
In the desired date column, I circle the “fastest available date” options.
The address is a PO box at the Nariyama Post Office.
Maybe I could even get a response today.
That is, if I can deliver the letter while it's still early.
I put the completed request form inside an envelope and stamp it for same day delivery.
I drop it in the mailbox then return to my spot on the sofa.
What do I do now?
I don't think I wanna see Dad right now.
I know we'll need to talk at some point.
But I'd rather talk to him after the situation changes a little.
For the time being, I guess I'll stay out here.
I turn my eyes to the camper.
I can sleep in there, thankfully.
When I open the door, all the heat that was trapped inside rushes out and hits my face.
This camper was my mom's workplace.
But that doesn't mean it's a dark room for anything.
There's a large monitor for checking photos and a strong anti-shaking lens holder.
There's also a high-spec printer and ladder that leads up to a bed for napping.
I climb up and lie on the bed.
Sumomo's words echo in my mind as I look up at the ceiling of the car.
I ended up hurting dad, huh?
While the garage can get really stuffy during the day, it cools down at night.
I'm even starting to feel a little chilly.
I already received a reply in the mailbox about the mechanic request.
“I'll be there on the 10th,” it said.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So tomorrow. They work fast, huh?
I look up from the letter and over at Hachimaru.
Will it work again?
And if it does, can I really drive it?
...It'll be fine.
I still remember how its motor purred as we drove up to the campsite in the mountains.
I remember the feel of the clutch, too.
I'm not completely inexperienced.
I can do it.
I should be able to.
...Even if I don't have a license.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mmh... Huh?
I sit up on the sofa.
Sunlight seeps in through the windows.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's morning?
Just then, there's a knock at the door.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Ah!
Did I just fall asleep yesterday?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Coming!
I dash over to the door.
When I open it, I'm met by a woman in a sleeveless top with a cigarette in her mouth.
A kid?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Um...
You're the one who called for me?
The woman says lazily, almost slurring her words.
I simply nod.
Hmm...
She drops the cigarette and grinds it beneath her heel.
Where's the car?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh, right. It's inside.
She walks into the garage with long, confident strides.
Ooh, what do we have here?
The woman approaches the car and drops her bag in front of it with a metallic thud.
Circling the car, she looks it all over.
Then she leans into the front, pops the hood, and peers inside.
So a genuine H-DT diesel turbo '91 Hachimaru. And it's a custom model for camping, huh? Pretty cool.
You did this? You even have a license?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No. It's my Mom's.
Your mom? Mmh... So this is a girl's ride. This gets better and better.
The woman takes a piece of paper out of her pocket.
It's the request form I filled out.
So Amei Kanna would be you?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, that's me.
Kanna, huh? So I can call you Candy Boy, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uh?
What about Candy Mommy? It's her car, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh, yeah... I wanted to surprise her by fixing it.
I'd prefer to talk with the owner, if you wouldn't mind.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: ...She's not here right now.
Huh...
I see. So you're a momma's boy that wants to do something sweet, then.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uhhh?
Is it just me, or this woman coming out with some weird stuff?
So, what's wrong with the car?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It doesn't work no matter what I do.
Hand over the key.
I take off the keychain I keep attached to my belt and pass it to her.
Man, there's nothing like turning on a car by shoving the key into the ignition yourself!
The woman happily climbs into the driver's seat, muttering to herself as she inserts the key.
Mmh... The electrical system is alive, at least.
Let's see...
I'll be taking a look inside, okay?
She to the bag on the floor, takes out some tools, then returns to the hood.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Can you fix it?
Mm, can't say yet. Gimme a minute.
After taking a look at the engine, the woman takes some kind of device out of her bag and hooks it up to Hachimaru.
Mmh...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: How does it look?
This is... pretty bad.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Bad?
Pretty damn bad.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I see...
I'll take a closer look. Take a seat over there, Candy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: C-Candy?
The diagnosis of the car takes far longer than I expected.
I sit on the couch and look over the photos I took the other day on my laptop.
The old Nariyama Airport Terminal is a great location.
It's nice that there aren't many people around.
It used to be an international airport, but it was closed down a long time ago.
All part of the history of Japan everyone learns about.
It's because of the artificial pigeons.
There's still a lot of them around. Always has been, as far as I know.
Hey, Candy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Candy...?
I'm talking to you, Candy Boy. That camera belong to Mommy Candy too?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Used to.
Your mommy has some cool hobbies, huh?
Hearing that actually makes me a little pleased.
Sadly, I have bad news for you. This car here's done for.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?
You know much about cars, Candy?
I shake my head.
Mhm. First of all, 90\% of the cars in circulation today run on batteries. The only people using cars that run on gas are a few enthusiasts.
And how easy it is to get spare parts is proportional to how many cars of the same model are out there. You follow me so far?
I nod.
I'm about to say that I get everything but her nicknaming decisions, but decide against it.
From what I can tell, you could replace some parts with common EV car components, but most of the core parts are showing their age.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Oh...
With the money you'd use trying to get those parts, you could buy yourself two cars brand new.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Whoa, really?
Hachimaru's pretty popular among collectors, you see. There's a demand, but not much in the way of supply, so the price hikes up.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But it was working until last year.
It was?! In this state?! Now that's a miracle!
That's the biggest surprise I've had all year!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So, uh, what's the estimate? How much will it set me back?
Can't give you one. I can't guarantee it'll work even if I manage to get my hands on all those pricey parts. The risk's too high for both of us, don'tcha think?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But...
That brings me to my offer. I know a buncha collectors that buy damaged cars.
As it is... how about 300K yen? You can go pick up a license with that money.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uh...
You'd have to pay a used car shop to get this thing off your hands, kid. It’s a good deal.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's not the problem!
What the hell? You're shrewder than I gave you credit for, huh? Got it! 400K! You're almost pushing me into the red there. How about it?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm not selling it. I wanna make it work.
...500K. You can get yourself a license AND a used bike with that much.
You'll go places with it! You'll be a hit among the ladies! I can see it already!
Argh, I get it! Man, you ain't sweet at all, Candy. I give. 550K, in cash, right now!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Get out! I'm not selling!
I pick up her bag and push it into her hands.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: If you can't fix it, I'll do it myself! Get outta here, hag!
The name's Azuki!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Wh-What? Azuki? Your name?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'm not some hag! My name's Azuki!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't care!
I push the woman that calls herself Azuki out of the garage.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: H-Hey! Candy! Stop it!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And don't come back!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: My tools! My scanner's in there! Hey!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Haah... Haah...
What was with her?
I knew trying to rely on other was a mistake.
But this has at least forced me to accept one thing:
I'm gonna have to fix it myself.
I need this car.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Is it really that hard to fix?
I walk up to Hachimaru, grab the key from the ignition, and hook the keychain back onto my belt.
Nothing's going my way.
Not one single thing.
I just want to take pictures like my mom.
I just wanna drive this car like Mom did and take the perfect picture of the comet that she wanted to take.
But all my efforts are going nowhere.
Heaving a sigh, I face Hachimaru.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What do I do? How can I fix you?
She said it's pretty bad.
That Azuki mechanic girl.
But what exactly is bad about it?
She said I could spend enough money to buy two cars and it still might not be enough to fix it.
How much does a new car cost?
I can't get that kind of money behind Dad's back.
I saved some money for repairs, but it's not nearly that much.
I climb up the ladder and lay down on the bed.
This weekend sucks major ass.
Everything's gone to hell.
I'm at a dead end.
I can't even seem to get drag myself to the starting point of becoming a photographer like her.
I'm in what used to be her workplace.
When I lay down in bed, I can see the roof of the garage through the sunroof.
As long as this car doesn't move, I'll never be able to see the starry sky from here again.
Everything's going terribly.
If mom was here, I'm sure she'd encourage me.
She always helped me to think of things I never even considered before.
I wish I had treasured our little moments together when she was alive more.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mom, was the place before no good either?

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I thought that Motosu place we went to last week was really pretty.

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: Yeah...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: We'll see Halley's Comet next year, right?

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: We sure will.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Shouldn't you start narrowing down the area where you wanna take the photos?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I mean, it only happens once every 70 years, right?

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: 76, actually.
She taps the ash off her cigarette and into a portable ashtray.
I keep looking up at her from the side.

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: Hey, Kanna.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah?
She exhales a thick cloud of smoke, then turns to me.

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: How would you like to be let in on one of Mommy's top secrets?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: A top secret? What is it?
My mom flashes me a sly smile.
When she does that, she looks more like a kid than I do.

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: Truth is, I already chose the location for the shoot. Long time ago, in fact.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Really?! Where?!

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: That'll be a surprise for 2061!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Whaaat? You can't just not say anything!

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: Too bad!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're such a kid!

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: That's fine by me.
Laughing, she puts out her cigarette.
Then turns towards my dad, who's fiddling with the car's engine.

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: Still not ready to go?

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Nah...

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: Looks like we're stuck for a bit.
She takes out another cigarette and lights it up.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But, Mom...

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why are we camping, then?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You don't need to scout for a location anymore, right?

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: Well...
She looks at Hachimaru while puffing out little smoke circles.
I follow her gaze.
Dad is bending over to peer under the hood.

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: Because he's a hopeless, boneheaded klutz.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: And because I hate losing.
Mom looks down at me and grins.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What's that me—

texts.name: Dad
texts.text: Hey, Kanna. Come over and help me.

texts.name: Anna
texts.text: Oh, he's calling you. Go on.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Okay.
I feel a nostalgic rumbling.
Oh, this must be another dream.
Whenever we all went location scouting as a family, I'd always sit in the backseat and the car would jostle around just like this.
Mom always hugged me close to her when I fell asleep.
At some point, I started feeling embarrassed about it, and I'd get sulky and pouty when I woke up with her beside me.
I never thought she'd be gone so quickly.
I wish I'd let her hug me a little more.
Why did I ever bother trying to act like I was too cool for it?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mom...
Shhh! Kanna, be quiet!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Momonouchi Sumomo?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Shh! Did you hear me just now?! And why're you using my full name?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Sumomo's fine!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?! What's happening? Where are we?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Inside of your car. Shh!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why is it moving?!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Because a thief is driving it. Shh!
Huh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah!
She pulls me closer to her to hide me from the person in the driver's seat.
Now her scent's all around me.
And something really soft is pressing against my face.
It's her peaches. Sumomo's peaches.
The soft, warm sensation along with the delicious scent overloads my senses.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I bet they plan to take you back to their lair then demand ransom from your daddy.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: We're running away as soon as the car stops, okay? Can you run?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mguh... Mmh...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hm? Kanna?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Mgh!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mm?
She relaxes her grip on my head and I'm finally released from her peaches.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Pwah! How did you expect me to speak like that?! You're too close! Get outta my space!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oops! Sorry!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But why?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: How is the car working?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah, it stopped.
I hear someone getting out of the driver's seat.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okay, this is our chance.
A shadowy figure passes by outside the window.
Hang on. I recognize that silhouette.
Keeping my body low, I peek out the window.
I see an out of service bus and a motorcycle.
There's also a semi-trailer parked in front of the bus.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's her!
The woman that came to see the car today.
The suspicious mechanic woman.
The one who wanted to buy Hachimaru.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's no kidnapper.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: She's a mechanic... No, she's just a thief. She's trying to steal Mom's car.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? Really? She wants to steal this crappy car?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: She said it couldn't be fixed. And she said it was too old! She figured she could cheat me 'cause I don't know anything about cars!
The woman clambers into the bus, humming a song to herself.
Is this where she lives?
I reach out to my belt.
They keychain's still there.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm taking it back. I'm not gonna let anyone steal my mom's car.
I remove the key from my belt.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Take it back?! How?!
Her voice suddenly booms into my ears.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll drive it back home.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You?! Where's your license?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't have one.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Won't that end badly?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's better than doing nothing and letting her steal it out from under my nose.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: A-Are you, like, really sure about this?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Nooo! I don't wanna die dressed like this!
I look back out the window.
The woman's looking at Hachimaru from the bus with satisfaction written across her face.
After a while, she pulls out a cigarette, lights it up, and turns her back on us.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Keep watch.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: For what?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Her.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're killing me here!
Turning my back on the panicked Sumomo, I get out of the camper and slowly stalk my way to the front of the car.
Keeping a look out for the woman, I scoot into the driver's seat.
She's still smoking in the bus.
I can see her flicking the ashes out a window.
I put the key in the ignition and turn it.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's working!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hm? ...Wha?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Gah! Candy! Why are yo—?!
The woman jumps out of the bus and comes barrelling straight toward me.
I release the handbrake, step on the clutch, and put the car into first gear.
When I release the clutch and step onto the accelerator, Hachimaru lurches forward.
I immediately shift into second gear.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hey! Dumbass! That's dangerous! Stop it right now!
She runs up to the passenger side door and opens it.
Then she reaches reaches out to grab the wheel.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Let go! Get off!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: This ain't a damn toy!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Fuck off!
Our two pairs of hands wildly struggle for the wheel.
Thanks to us both pulling in different directions, Hachimaru loses control.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: We're gonna freakin' crash! My bike! Aah! Let go of the fucking wheel!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You let go! Thief!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: The breaks! Hits the breaks!
Hachimaru crashes into the motorcycle, crushing it against the side of the bus.
The loud metallic crunch sends shivers down my spine!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Noooooooooo! My bike! You're crushing it!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Wh-What the fuck are you doing?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I-I gotta reverse... Reverse!
I step on the clutch and put the car into reverse gear.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I-It's crushed as flat as a pancake! What the hell are you doing?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Shut up! Let me think!
I put the car in second gear again.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Why second again?!
Then I turn the wheel all the way to the left and step on the accelerator.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: No, no, no! You're not gonna make that turn!
She begins pulling on the wheel again.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hit the brakes! This ain't gonna fucking work! Listen to me!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You're doing the same thing as before! What's the big idea?! You're not pounding mochi here, boy!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I wanted to turn!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: With what space, eh?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Reverse! Fucking reverse all the way!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Listen to me! The bike's leaking gas!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Gas?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Reverse if you don't wanna fucking kill us!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Fuck!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Reverse!
I step on the clutch, shift gears, and hit the gas!
And just as Hachimaru begins backing up...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Fire in the hooooole!
In an instant, everything outside the windshield is covered in flames.
Caught in the blast, Hachimaru is pushed back even faster.
We speed away from the burning bus.
The bus, the bike, and the semi-trailer are all going up in flames.
Hachimaru's sudden backward momentum only stops when we hit the guardrail behind us.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: My house... My bike... My trailer...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It's all burned down... Hahah...
The woman falls to the her knees in front of the sea of flames.
I stand there, staring at Hachimaru. Its engine has stopped working again.
The thief simply gazes at the smoldering remnants of the bus.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: My mom's Hachimaru...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: My bike... My house... My tools...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: And my Hachimaru...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's not yours!
Just then, the door at the back of the camper slowly opens.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What are you implying here?!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Wh-What?! Y-You're the one who stole my car!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Yeah, and? All I did was steal it!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Wh-What?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You didn't have to fuck me up like this!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: My house! My bike! And even my damn semi-trailer! They're all burned to a crisp!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: That's what you get for being a thief!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: This ain't fair at all! Fuck you!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No, fuck you!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Wh-What?! What's going on?! Am I alive?! Is this heaven?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Damn, how many people you got back there?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's just us.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Gah!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: S-Stay away from Kanna!
Sumomo jabs an accusatory finger at the thief and gets between us.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What's with the chick?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Y-You tried to take hostages, didn't you? Th-The cops will get you for this!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You what?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Grr!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Who's this, Candy? Your girl?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You two were doing it back there?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: No! Shut up!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Stop talking like I'm not here!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: She's my teacher. Kinda.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: H-Her?
I nod.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: This bitch is a teach?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I CAN HEAR YOU!
After heaving a huge sigh, the woman walks up to Sumomo.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Wh-What? Whaddya want?!
Then she walks right past her, without a glance at the trembling Sumomo, and goes straight for Hachimaru.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Uh...
She opens the hood and looks inside.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Aw, crud... I just fixed the damn thing.
I walk up besides her and peer down at the engine too.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: How did you fix it?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: How did you start it without the key?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Trade secret.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Tell me!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You wouldn't understand even if I told ya. I just replaced the faulty parts and did some maintenance.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Amateur.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?!
Azuki takes out the same device from before and hooks it up to Hachimaru.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hoo boy... The electrical system's busted now.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: And I had it purring like a cat...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Y-You said it was bad! You said it couldn't be fixed!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: There's nothing I can't fix.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Because I'm the one and only scrap hunter extraordinaire!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Wh-Why would you do that without permission?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: All cars want to run free on the roads, my sweet Candy.
I catch Sumomo slowly approaching Hachimaru as well.
While I can see her at the corner of my vision, I don't feel safe enough to take my eyes fully off the thief and the engine.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's not gonna work anymore?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Not a chance in hell. It's not like parts for this kind of old car are just falling into my lap.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: This thing is 70 years old.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: So, what are you gonna do with it?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll take it back home.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Are your ears busted too? It ain't going anywhere, kid.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll push it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Push?! You can push cars?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I don't think you're gonna get too far with it on your own, Candy.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hrm...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Well, I guess it ain't that far.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What? You're coming too?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What else can I do?! I don't have a home anymore, remember?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: That was my house you crashed into and burned down just now!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh? You mean that bus?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Damn right.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Lady, are you homeless?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I wasn't till five minutes ago!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: And I'm a scrap hunter! Not some lady!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Scrap hunter? What's that?
The woman sticks a cigarette into her mouth and starts clearing up some of the rubble scattered around.
We watch her for a while.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hey, Kanna.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What's a scrap hunter? What does she do?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I dunno.
The three of us push the car along Nariyama's dark roads.
There's almost no street lights.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoa, cool! It really does move when you push it.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Of course it does. Before they came up with engines, these were pulled by horses.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Huh! Makes sense.
The sparsely lit road seems to stretch on forever.
At least it's flat.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hey, what's your name, lady?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: My name's Momonouchi Sumomo.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Whoa, did your parents hate you or something?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! You're telling me!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You sure you're a teach, chickadee?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mhm! I'm a college student doing my teacher training.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What's that?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Some silly requirement to become a real teacher.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I actually give lessons and all.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: That so? Man, I find that hard to believe.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You think so too?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I can see through that stuffy getup you got going on.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You're not into teaching at all, are you?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! Bingo!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Well at least one of us seems to be having fun.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I mean, isn't it kinda funny?! We're all just a big bunch of idiots!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Especially the guy that steps on the gas and asks questions later.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're the one that stole my mom's car!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Amei Anna passed away last year, didn't she?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Wha?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Is it still in her name?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You knew this whole time?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Man, I was this close to making so much bank selling off Amei Anna's Hachimaru.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: With just a little bit of work, I would've had it running perfectly.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: To think the scrap hunter would be turned to scrap instead...

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So that's how it is, huh?
So she knew the car was my mom's and targeted it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Wait a minute, you knew Kanna's mommy too?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: She was pretty well known among car enthusiasts.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: If you ride around in a beauty like this, it turns heads.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Kanna's mommy sure was cool, wasn't she?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh? Kanna?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Cat got your tongue?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I don't talk to thieves. She's a criminal.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'd say we're in the same boat, boy. Or can you show me your driver's license?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Don't lump me in with you!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Now now, kids, no fighting.
We keep pushing the car, inching it forward little by little.
I'm really glad it's not a steep road.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So, what's your name, Miss Thief?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'm... You can call me Scrap Hunter Azuki.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! Talk about lame!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It's not lame! I'm gonna kill you!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's totes lame! Right, Kanna?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You bitch!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm not a bitch, dummy. I'm a peach.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Huh? Peach? Oh, 'cause of your name?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm the peachy Sumomo Momonouchi!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Gotcha...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Sooo you're the Bitchy Peach.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ahahah! Now that's lame!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It's not lame! Shut up! I'm gonna get you for this!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Pfft! What's what supposed to be? My nickname? Did you come up with it just now?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Obviously!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hah... What about Kanna? Did you give him a nickname too?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: The little squirt is Candy Boy!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hahahah! Ahahahahah!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Maaan! You're the queen of lame!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'm not! I'm gonna fucking kill you when we're done with this!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're kinda messed up in the head, huh?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I don't wanna hear that from you!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You two are insane...
In the end, we push the car for over an hour before finally making it home.
When I see that the house is dark, I heave a sigh of relief.
If my dad were to see us in this situation, I don't know how I'd explain.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Finally!
Hachimaru is back in its rightful place in the garage.
Sumomo plops down onto the sofa.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That was, like, so far! I thought you said it wouldn't be that hard!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Well, we got here in the end, didn't we?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I didn't think it'd take turning my arms and legs into jelly.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And I gotta go to the academy tomorrow. Will I even be able to wake up if I fall asleep?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'll get scolded again if I'm late.
Now that I take a closer look at it under the light, I see dents all over Hachimaru's body.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Well then.
Azuki looks my way.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What do you want?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Thanks to a certain someone, I'm now homeless.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I don't think you even had a house in the first place.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Shut it!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're the one who started it!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Just listen to me, will you, Candy?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Candy...
She says, holding back a chuckle.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I also used that SR to get around.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: SR?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: The bike.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: And the semi-trailer I used for work is also trashed.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It was quite a terrible tragedy you caused me, wouldn't you say?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You're awfully mouthy for a thief.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: This garage is pretty sweet. I like it. You have tools here, and it's pretty damn comfy.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What are you getting at?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'm gonna crash here for a while, capisce?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You what?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: In exchange, I'll keep quiet about you driving without a license and trashing my stuff.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What are you smoking?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: If I remember right, you called me here behind your dad's back, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Whoa, really? Your daddy didn't know?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What did you call a scrap hunter for?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I requested her because she called herself a mobile mechanic.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Mooobile mechanic?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You don't get it yet? She's a scammer. She only came here to steal the car.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Geez, you sure like to make everything sound worse than it has to. Didn't I say I'd buy it off you?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: And I refused it, so you stole it?!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Not quite. I just came to pick up my tools and borrowed the car to carry 'em.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Remember how you forced me out without even letting me pick up my stuff?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: All I hear are excuses!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'm not cutting you a bad deal, boy. I'm not staying forever—just for the summer.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You never know, I might even leave sooner if I find another sucker to mooch off.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: So you're basically calling me a sucker?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So she is.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Anyway. I'll scram as soon as I find another place to crash.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Fine. On one condition.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Oh?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: You said we both did wrong tonight, right? It benefits us both to keep quiet about it.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Makes sense. So?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Fix the car again. If you do that, you're free to stay.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Mmh...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It kind of feels like I'm the one losing here, to be quite honest. Besides...
Azuki walks up to Hachimaru and peeks under the hood again.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Like I told you earlier, parts for this kind of old car ain't that easy to find.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: It'll cost money, and you'll have to shoulder the cost of the parts. If you're okay with that, I can get it back to how it was.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: But even if I do that, I can't guarantee it'll work again.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Okay. You have a deal.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You can pay?
I nod.
I have money saved up for this.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: As long as it's not crazy money.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Let's see...
She thinks for a while then presents me with an estimate.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Yeah, I can pay that.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Okay. We have a deal, then.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ah.
Both of us turn to Sumomo.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So, I should, like, keep quiet about this too, right?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I gotta keep what happened today from the police, your daddy, and anyone else?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I was worried for Kanna since he isn't going to class, so I came to check on him, and then I saw a suspicious person stalking around his garage.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And after I jumped into the car to save him, I was left alone and tossed around like a rag doll due to some people's reckless driving.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: But it'd be better if I didn't tell anyone about it...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Riiiight?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Bitchy Peach, you're craftier than you look, eh?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're absolutely right.
A sigh of exasperation leaves my mouth.
I can see where this is going.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You're coming back to the academy, right, Kanna?
There it is.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: It's just one week until the end-of-term ceremony! If don't care what you do as long as you show up to class!
She raises her right hand and declares loudly.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Go to your classes, Candy. You're a student, right?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Not you too...

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I have a name, cretin. It's Azuki. Use it, love it.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What's your problem?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Go to class. And no pouting about it, Candy.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, what she said.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I get it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yes! I did it! This is my turnaround! Now I can complete my teacher training!

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll only go this week. That's all.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yeah, yeah! Whatever! I didn't go to class either back in my day.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Do whatever you want in the second semester.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: You're a whack teacher, you know?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right? I agree!
She lets out a hearty laugh, but it stops when her gaze falls on me.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Say, can I ask you one more thing?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: There's just ooone little thing that's been bugging me ever since we met.
I stay silent and wait for her to continue.
Then I notice her lifting her eyes to a spot right on the top of my head.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Can I cut your hair?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Excuse me?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Let her cut it, and no pouting about it, Candy. It's not the end of the world.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: But it's the end of my hair.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Why do you carry scissors with you?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hm? For myself? I trim my own bangs.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I don't think hiding your face helps with that gloomy mood of yours. Do you like it long or something?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I've just been too busy to cut it.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: That's no good! Self care and fashion are important!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Taking care of yourself is the first step to learning to love yourself.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Can I cut it short?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Sure, go wild.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yippee! You have a really cute face, so I think you should show it off!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I'm gonna snip snip now, okay?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ta-dah!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: All done! What do you think?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh? You don't like it?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uh, no. It isn't bad.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: And this is how it looks at the back.
She holds a small hand mirror behind my head and shows me the nape of my neck.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: It's...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I thought it'd look weird.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: So it looks better than you expected?
I simply nod.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Phew, I'm so happy to hear that! Take a look at this, Azuki!
Azuki, who's still tinkering with the car, turns our way.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Suits him, doesn't it? He looks like he could be in a boy band.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Sure does. He'd be the cheeky one.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: I know, right?! Now you're all ready for class tomorrow!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: You might even have to fend off the girls!

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: What do you say? Think you can like this new you? Not bad, is it?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I guess...

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Right on!

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: I'll be borrowing this sofa, okay, Candy?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Uh, sure.

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: Doesn't bother me. I'm sleeping in the car.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: What? You're gonna sleep in here too?

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Don't you have a house right here?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'm sleeping here tonight. And that's that.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Things still awkward with your daddy?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Oh, but if you're going to class tomorrow, I bet it'd help if you told him.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Okay?

texts.name: Kanna
texts.text: I'll tell him soon.

texts.name: Azuki
texts.text: Hey, Bitch. You planning on walking home?

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Stop calling me that! If you're gonna shorten it, at last call me 'Peach' instead.

texts.name: Sumomo
